intro: Pleiospora bolusii, commonly known as the African sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, succulent leaves. The plant produces tiny, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
